images.description: Feathered animals with beaks and wings, known for their ability to fly and diverse appearances.
Fast, spotted big cats known for their incredible speed, reaching up to 60-70 mph to catch prey on open plains.
Large, intelligent mammals with trunks, known for their strong social bonds and impressive memory.
Small, tailless amphibians with smooth skin, long legs for jumping, and a life cycle that includes both aquatic and terrestrial stages.
Tall mammals with long necks, spotted coats, and long legs, known for browsing treetops in African savannas.
Large animals with powerful hind legs, strong tails, known for their unique hopping locomotion across Australia's landscapes.
Intelligent, playful animals that live in trees.
Bears with black-and-white fur. They eat a lot of bamboo and are calm animals.
Striped mammals related to horses, known for their unique black-and-white coats and social behavior in herds across African grasslands.
